metadata.description:
hi. i’m Annika Rose. 

i’ve been an artist in the industry since I was 9 years old, and man have i seen some shit - the good, the bad, and the ugly. 

in 2016 i lost my first major record deal, my family broke down and drastically reassembled…. i cycled through more unfulfilling deals and ghostly promises until the world was shut down by the pandemic.  it became increasingly more obvious to me that the only promise i could make was to myself and to my art. and the only way to relinquish control over it was to fearlessly trust in it. 

“Bruises” is a song i wrote about a friend. a friend quite literally covered in self-inflicted bruises, but more importantly it’s become about how others’ metaphorical “bruises” can so quickly become your own; how pain is so contagious, especially around people who you love and care for the most. 

this song is my first audio nft; the daunting yet seemingly very special first step of a journey into greater ownership, creativity, and connection in my art. i’m excited for the world to hear it as a reminder that taking care of your mental health can be the hardest but end up being the most rewarding path to walk. for yourself and for everyone in your orbit.

lyrics.text:
naked and broken 
baring your soul 
that’s where the truth is 
at the bottom of it all 

you pick up the phone you’re on the floor somewhere you shouldn’t be
the less I know the better off is what you say back to me 
I wanna know I gotta know I need to know 
if you can make it home alive 

what a lonely fight to fight for a feeling you don’t have to hide 
cry for a reason you don’t have to cry 
every burden that you’re choosing 
is a fantasy 
twisted tales that only you believe 
lie to your friends and all your family 
makeup won’t cover your excuses 
and doesn’t cover up ur bruises 

special occasions 
aren’t on a tuesday night 
justification is just a vacation 
for your mind 

you’re blowing smoke up in the air like you’re on fire baby 
calling for help don’t know you need like the guns off of safety 
I wanna know I gotta know I need to know 
if you can make it home alive 

what a lonely fight to fight for a feeling you don’t have to hide 
cry for a reason you don’t have to cry 
every burden that you’re choosing 
is a fantasy 
twisted tales that only you believe 
lie to your friends and all your family 
makeup won’t cover your excuses 
and doesn’t cover up ur bruises 

inside outside of your body 
how did pain become your hobby?
bruises, covered in bruises 
how far you’d go to disappear 
but I still see em I see you I see all your bruises
I see all your bruises

metadata.name: Bruises #1
metadata.title: Bruises
